android.health.pedometer
Class ExcerciseSessionList

java.lang.Object
  android.health.pedometer.ExcerciseSessionList

public class ExcerciseSessionList
extends java.lang.Object

This class is responsible for storing, managing, and allowing access to the history of all the user's exercise sessions recorded by this session. Ultimately, all non-pedometer components of the application that wish to access pedometer-related information must use this class to access the data further down.

Author:
Joel Botner

Method Detail

addSession

public ExcerciseSession addSession(int travelType,
                                   boolean useGPS)
Creates a new ExerciseSession according to the specified type and monitoring method.

Parameters:
travelType - - The type of exercise the user is doing: 1 for walking, 2 for running, and 3 for biking.
useGPS - - Boolean value whether to use the GPS to monitor the exercise or not. If the GPS is not used, the application will fall back to using the built-in accelerometer.
Returns:
The new ExcerciseSession created.

monitoringDone

public void monitoringDone(ExcerciseSession thatSession,
                           java.lang.String title,
                           java.lang.String secondsTaken,
                           long startTime,
                           boolean logThis)
Must be called when a exercise session is complete so it can be logged in the database.

Parameters:
thatSession - - The ExcerciseSession that was just completed.
title - - The name of this exercise session.
secondsTaken - - How many seconds the user took to complete this session
startTime - - The start time of this exercise session according to GregorianCalendar format
logThis - - Whether or not to log this session to the database
